question: 21. Does Route 53 supports zone apex records?
options: D. No
A. Yes, for all domains
C. Yes, but only for services hosted on AWS
B. Yes, but only for domains hosted on AWS
answers: A. Yes, for all domains

question: 22. Which of the following statements are false? (Choose two.)
options: A. Route 53 does not allow aliases for naked domain names.
B. Route 53 supports zone apex records.
D. Route 53 only supports zone apex records for AWS-hosted services.
C. Route 53 allows aliases for domains hosted on AWS.
answers: A. Route 53 does not allow aliases for naked domain names.
D. Route 53 only supports zone apex records for AWS-hosted services.

question: 23. Which of the following statements are true? (Choose two.)
options: B. Route 53 automatically configures DNS health checks for registered domains.
D. Route 53 is automatically highly available.
C. Route 53 automatically sets up Auto Scaling groups for services to which it points.
A. Route 53 supports Auto Scaling groups.
answers: D. Route 53 is automatically highly available.
A. Route 53 supports Auto Scaling groups.

question: 24. How many domain names can you manage using Route 53?
options: B. 100, but you can raise that limit by contacting AWS support.
D. 50, but you can raise that limit by contacting AWS support.
C. Unlimited
answers: D. 50, but you can raise that limit by contacting AWS support.

question: 25. Which of the following is the best approach to accessing an RDS instance to troubleshoot operating system problems?
options: D. None of these
A. SSH
B. RDP
C. SFTP
answers: D. None of these

question: 26. Which of the following are true about VPC peering? (Choose two.)
options: A. A VPC peering connection is a networking connection between two VPCs within a single region.
C. A VPC peering connection can help facilitate data transfer and file sharing.
B. A VPC peering connection is a VPN-based connection.
D. Peered VPCs can exist in different regions.
answers: D. Peered VPCs can exist in different regions.
C. A VPC peering connection can help facilitate data transfer and file sharing.

question: 27. You have two VPCs paired across two different regions. What is another name for this type of connection?
options: A. Inter-VPC peering connection
B. Inter-region VPC peering connection
C. Inter-VPC region connection
D. Multi-region peering connection
answers: B. Inter-region VPC peering connection

question: 28. Which of the following statements about peered VPCs is false?
options: B. Both VPCs do not need to be in the same AWS account.
A. Both VPCs do not need to be within the same region.
D. Traffic can flow in both directions between peered VPCs by default.
C. Both VPCs will automatically have routing set up when the connection is created.
answers: C. Both VPCs will automatically have routing set up when the connection is created.

question: 29. Which of the following statements about peered VPCs is true?
options: D. The two VPCs cannot have overlapping CIDR blocks.
C. Each VPC must use a unique security group.
A. Both VPCs need to be within the same region.
B. Both VPCs need to be in the same AWS account.
answers: D. The two VPCs cannot have overlapping CIDR blocks.

question: 30. What kind of relationship is a VPC peering connection?
options: C. One-to-many between subnets
D. One-to-many between VPCs
B. One-to-one between VPCs
A. One-to-one between subnets
answers: B. One-to-one between VPCs

question: 31. VPC A is peered to both VPC B and VPC C. How can you allow traffic to flow from VPC B to VPC C?
options: B. You must enable route forwarding in VPC A.
A. You can’t; transitive peering relationships are not allowed in AWS.
D. You must enable route forwarding on VPC B.
C. You must peer VPC B to VPC C.
answers: C. You must peer VPC B to VPC C.

question: 32. VPC C has an overlapping CIDR block with VPC D. Given that, which of the following statements are true? (Choose two.)
options: C. To peer VPC C and VPC D, you must remove the overlap in their CIDR block.
B. VPC C and VPC D cannot be peered as is.
A. VPC C and VPC D can be peered as is.
D. To peer VPC C and VPC D, you must switch one to use IPv6 addresses.
answers: C. To peer VPC C and VPC D, you must remove the overlap in their CIDR block.
B. VPC C and VPC D cannot be peered as is.

question: 33. How many peering connections are allowed between two VPCs?
options: A. One
C. One for each subnet in each VPC
D. One for each NACL associated with each VPC
B. Two
answers: A. One

question: 34. How many peering connections can a single VPC be a part of?
options: A. One
B. Unlimited, within AWS overall account limits
D. One for each NACL associated with each VPC
C. One for each subnet in each VPC
answers: B. Unlimited, within AWS overall account limits

question: 35. How does AWS facilitate transitive peering VPC relationships?
options: A. Transitive VPC relationships are only allowed if a bastion host is used.
D. It uses IPv4 for connection from a source VPC to a hub VPC and IPv6 from the hub to the origin VPC.
B. Transitive VPC relationships are only allowed if a hub-and-spoke network model is used.
C. It does not; transitive VPC peering is not allowed in AWS.
answers: C. It does not; transitive VPC peering is not allowed in AWS.

question: 36. How does AWS support IPv6 communication in a VPC peering relationship? (Choose two.)
options: A. AWS does not support IPv6 communication in VPC peering.
B. You must associate IPv6 addresses with both VPCs and then set up routing to use these addresses.
D. You must make sure the two VPCs are in the same region.
C. You must associate IPv6 addresses with both VPCs and then set up a security group to use these addresses.
answers: B. You must associate IPv6 addresses with both VPCs and then set up routing to use these addresses.
D. You must make sure the two VPCs are in the same region.

question: 37. Which of the following are advantages of launching instances into a VPC as opposed to EC2-Classic? (Choose two.)
options: B. Your instances automatically run on multi-tenant hardware.
C. You can attach multiple network interfaces to your instances.
D. Your network is flat instead of layered.
A. You can assign multiple IP addresses to your instances.
answers: C. You can attach multiple network interfaces to your instances.
A. You can assign multiple IP addresses to your instances.

question: 38. Which of the following are differences between the default VPC and a custom VPC? (Choose two.)
options: C. Custom VPCs have an internet gateway but default VPCs do not.
A. Default VPCs have an internet gateway but custom VPCs do not.
B. Custom VPCs have public subnets but default VPCs do not.
D. Default VPCs have public subnets but custom VPCs do not.
answers: A. Default VPCs have an internet gateway but custom VPCs do not.
D. Default VPCs have public subnets but custom VPCs do not.

question: 39. How does the default VPC make instances in its public subnets available to Internet traffic? (Choose two.)
options: C. Through a default security group that provides access out to the Internet
A. Through a default routing table that provides routing to the Internet
D. Through an internet gateway
B. Through a virtual private gateway
answers: A. Through a default routing table that provides routing to the Internet
D. Through an internet gateway

question: 40. Which of the following is assigned to instances launched into non-default subnets?
options: A. A private IPv6 address
C. A private IPv4 address
D. A public IPv6 address
B. A public IPv4 address
answers: C. A private IPv4 address
